channel.title: Jar'ing And Signing Your Webclient
channel.description:
Difficulty: Very Easy! Purpose: To Jar And sign your Webclient. Client's Tested on: Should work on all clients with auto Cache downloader.
[b]Step 1;[/b] Download the [url=http://download.cnet.com/JAR-Maker/3000-2213_4-10588876.html]"Jar-Maker"[/url] Once you have that Downloaded Open up "Jarmaker.jar" [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/2qi5l5h.jpg[/img] [b]Step 2;[/b] Choose your output file! [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/2crud50.jpg[/img] Output part 2 [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/vpylpd.jpg[/img] You can also Change "client.jar" to whatever you want the jared client to be, It's mainly client.jar, If you change it. make sure its "Whateveryouwant.jar" Dont forget the .jar! [b]Step 3;[/b] Where it says "Input" Browse and find your Client files! [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/t0jk9c.jpg[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------- Once you Have Found and Chose your client Folder You will see a box below input saying "Manifest" in that box type Main-Class: Gui (or What ever your run.bat uses to run the client! sometimes it maybe Jframe or client!
[IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/a14gfo.jpg[/img]
Now Click "Create Jar" then it will be created where you directed it to go (thats your Output Directory) So if you put Your desktop path in your output Option it will create the Jar on the desktop.
It should Say "Succesfully created Jar" Or something along those lines. This means your client has been jarred So it is playable but you cannot play it on your webhost, thats what signing is for. DO NOT EXIT YOUR JARMAKER ONCE YOU JARRED YOUR CLIENT! CLICK THE OPTION "JAR Signer" [size=14pt] SIGNING YOUR JARRED CLIENT[/size]
[size=10pt]Step 1![/size] Once In JAR Signer. Click Jarsigner location. The main directory for that is mainly [size=12pt]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\jarsigner.exe[/size] (CHANGE 21 TO YOUR JDK TYPE!) [IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/152i8sj.jpg[/img]
[size=10pt]Step 2![/size] Genrating a Key Store May look hard but is Simple! Ill try and explain most of it in the pic! Click "Generate Keystore" Then for the Keystore location put C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\keytool.exe once again change 21 to your jdk type.
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2it3m1w.jpg[/img] For your Public and Private Keys Put 123456 Its easy to remember and does like nothing.. Replace "Server name" with your server name. [size=12pt]Step 3![/size] ALMOST DONE! Now Put your Keystore file Location as your client.jar directory so Browse for you client.jar. [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2uxyzom.jpg[/img]
Fill in Keystore Alias with the one you generated same with the Public Key and private key Should be 123456 if you did what i said! Then click "Sign Jar"
and your done..
Guys i'm positive that there will be an error there If there is one Please tell me and i'll fix it. [size=14pt]Credits; Me JarMaker RuneSpace.[/size]
Guys i know this is easy But i have been getting many pms about How to Jar there clients.. And sorry if this is badly formatted I am very tired, When i wake up tomorrow ill Fix it up a bit

item.title: Jar'ing And Signing Your Webclient
item.dc:creator: @iFuze iFuze
item.description:
@iFuze wrote:

I am done with edit my server, now am just going to send out my client. Making a client.jar so people can download it, no webclient. But i fallow the tut but when am going to lounch it it do not start.

“Once you Have Found and Chose your client Folder You will see a box below input saying “Manifest” in that box type Main-Class: Gui (or What ever your run.bat uses to run the client! sometimes it maybe Jframe or client!”

I don’t know what to put as manifest.
This is my my run.bat:

@echo off
title Steady-Pwn
start javaw -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
EXIT

Plz help me. Sorry for bad english

Read full topic

item.title: Jar'ing And Signing Your Webclient
item.dc:creator: @artego artego
item.description:
@artego wrote:

Doesn’t work for me whatever I try, yes I already made autodownloadercache etc
I can play the jar. But as soon as I embed it it won’t work, this is my error

java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client

Read full topic

item.title: Jar'ing And Signing Your Webclient
item.dc:creator: @PLayRooney PLayRooney
item.description:
@PLayRooney wrote:

Difficulty: Very Easy!
Purpose: To Jar And sign your Webclient.
Client’s Tested on: Should work on all clients with auto Cache downloader.

Step 1;
Download the “Jar-Maker”
Once you have that Downloaded Open up “Jarmaker.jar”

Step 2;
Choose your output file!

Output part 2

You can also Change “client.jar” to whatever you want the jared client to be, It’s mainly client.jar, If you change it. make sure its “Whateveryouwant.jar” Dont forget the .jar!
Step 3;
Where it says “Input” Browse and find your Client files!

Once you Have Found and Chose your client Folder You will see a box below input saying “Manifest” in that box type Main-Class: Gui (or What ever your run.bat uses to run the client! sometimes it maybe Jframe or client!

Now Click “Create Jar” then it will be created where you directed it to go (thats your Output Directory)
So if you put Your desktop path in your output Option it will create the Jar on the desktop.

It should Say “Succesfully created Jar” Or something along those lines. This means your client has been jarred So it is playable but you cannot play it on your webhost, thats what signing is for.
DO NOT EXIT YOUR JARMAKER ONCE YOU JARRED YOUR CLIENT! CLICK THE OPTION “JAR Signer”
[size=14pt]
SIGNING YOUR JARRED CLIENT[/size]

[size=10pt]Step 1![/size]
Once In JAR Signer. Click Jarsigner location. The main directory for that is mainly [size=12pt]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\jarsigner.exe[/size] (CHANGE 21 TO YOUR JDK TYPE!)

[size=10pt]Step 2![/size]
Genrating a Key Store May look hard but is Simple! Ill try and explain most of it in the pic!
Click “Generate Keystore” Then for the Keystore location put C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\keytool.exe once again change 21 to your jdk type.

2it3m1w.jpg523×598

For your Public and Private Keys Put 123456 Its easy to remember and does like nothing…
Replace “Server name” with your server name.
[size=12pt]Step 3![/size]
ALMOST DONE!
Now Put your Keystore file Location as your client.jar directory so Browse for you client.jar.

Fill in Keystore Alias with the one you generated same with the Public Key and private key Should be 123456 if you did what i said! Then click “Sign Jar”

and your done…

Guys i’m positive that there will be an error there If there is one Please tell me and i’ll fix it.
[size=14pt]Credits;
Me
JarMaker
RuneSpace.[/size]

Guys i know this is easy But i have been getting many pms about How to Jar there clients… And sorry if this is badly formatted I am very tired, When i wake up tomorrow ill Fix it up a bit

Read full topic
